metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5272 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The nsImageGeometryMixin class in Mozilla Firefox before 49.0, Firefox ESR 45.x before 45.4, and Thunderbird < 45.4 does not properly perform a cast of an unspecified variable during handling of INPUT elements, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.4.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
